alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 2:12AM MDT until June 04 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County. For the Clear Creek...including Chinook...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, At 8.0 feet, water is about 2 to 3 feet deep in corrals along Clear Creek. (April 8, 2023) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM MDT Sunday was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 3.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It is then forecast to remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 04/09/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM MDT.
